data.title: Carbon Capture Materials Market to reach $99,098.5 million by 2030, due to demand from high-emission industries. Membranes and alkaline solvents key materials, with post-combustion capture reducing up to 90% of CO2. Regulatory pressures and carbon markets drive demand. Market poised for growth with stricter emission limits globally.
data.description: The Carbon Capture Materials Market is expected to grow from USD 66,904.7 million in 2025 to USD 99,098.5 million by 2030 at a CAGR of 8.2%. Industries like cement, steel, and chemicals aiming to decarbonize are driving the demand for carbon capture materials. CCS systems, like membranes and alkaline solvents, help in reducing CO2 emissions up to 90%. Stricter emission regulations in Europe and North America are prompting industries to adopt CCS, boosting the market for capture materials. Key players in the market include Ecolab, BASF, DOW, and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries. Membranes are expected to dominate the material segment, and power generation leads in end-use industry segment. Major challenges include high energy requirements and costs for large-scale material regeneration. The study's full details are available on Benzinga.com.

data.title: InnoCare doses first patient in China trial for ADC ICP-B794, showing potent tumor-killing effects in large tumors.
data.description: Results from preclinical studies show that ICP-B794 has displayed impressive anti-tumor efficacy in animal models. It has shown notable tumor-killing capabilities, particularly in sizable tumors.

data.title: Ecopetrol to release Q3 2025 results after market close on Nov 13 and hold conference call on Nov 14.
data.description: Colombian company Ecopetrol S.A. (BVC: ECOPETROL; NYSE: EC) has revealed its intention to publish its financial and operational performance for Q3 of 2025 after the market closes on Thursday, November 13, 2025. The data will be made public on Friday, November 14, 2025, showcasing the company's progress during the quarter.

data.title: Forum Energy Technologies reported Q3 2025 revenue of $196 million with a net loss of $21 million. Adjusted net income was $3 million.
data.description: Houston-based Forum Energy Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: FET) revealed their third-quarter 2025 financial results today, reporting a revenue of $196 million. However, the company suffered a net loss of $21 million, equivalent to $1.76 per diluted share. Adjusted for $22 million in asset impairments and restructuring costs, as well as a $5 million tax valuation allowance reserve, the company's adjusted net income stood at $3 million, translating to around $0.27 per diluted share. Neal Lux, the President and CEO of the company, shared these figures in the announcement.

data.title: Employment lawyers file suit against Mariner Finance, LLC for alleged discrimination against a terminated employee.
data.description: Mariner Finance, LLC is facing allegations of discrimination and wrongful termination involving an employee due to her medical condition and reproductive health decisions. The plaintiff claims she was fired from her job at the company after seeking more time for her leave.

data.title: Allied Gaming & Entertainment (AGAE) showcases growth with major events at HyperX Arena in Las Vegas, celebrating leadership in live entertainment and esports.
data.description: Allied Gaming & Entertainment Inc. (NASDAQ: AGAE), a global experiential entertainment company, recently marked two significant events at its flagship property, Allied Esports’ HyperX Arena in Las Vegas. The celebrations demonstrate the company’s continued dominance in live entertainment, esports, and global event production.

data.title: Documentary "Homeland Restored" honors Taiwan's 80 years post-Japanese occupation with a 6-episode series on CCTV4.
data.description: In Beijing on October 31, 2025, China Media Group unveiled a new six-episode historical documentary series titled "Homeland Restored: 80 Years Since Taiwan's Recovery from Japanese Occupation" to commemorate the 80th anniversary of Taiwan's liberation.
